page.title: 13Broadhempston Life
page.content: The big majority of the villagers are either retired or comute to work in Newton Abbot, Torbay or Totnes. A number of owners of older picturesqe houses offer Bed and Breakfast to attract holidaymakers to the village. There are four farms within the village, two dairy, one stock and one arable, all of them small family run businesses. The only industrial business is a plant hire and trailer manufacturing concern with repair facilities for commercial vehicles. As an example of the old buildings, Well House was built in about 1780 probably from locally quarried stone. It was once the Manor House and was named after three wells in its grounds, two of which are known. Now a part-time smallholding with poultry and exotic pets it was once a village cider works.
